intro: Pedicularis exaltata, commonly known as the tall monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
